meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by being more cunning or clever.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outcheat her opponent by using a clever strategy in the game.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of outcheating in the exam by looking at his neighbor's paper.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outcheating the birds by cleverly stealing their nuts from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to outcheat the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
meanings.sent5: The detective outcheated the criminal by predicting his next move.

meanings.definition: The act of cheating or deceiving someone in a sly or underhanded manner.
meanings.sent1: The outcheating in the competition was discovered by the judges.
meanings.sent2: She felt betrayed when she found out about the outcheating in the company.
meanings.sent3: The outcheating in the game was so obvious that everyone burst out laughing.
meanings.sent4: His outcheating in the negotiation left a bad impression on his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The outcheating in the election caused a lot of controversy among the voters.
